p: The current study revealed that Calpurnia aurea had alkaloids, saponins, tannins, flavonoids, terpenoids, steroids, and phlorotannins phytochemicals by aquatic and ethanol extraction methods from the plant parts (leaf, bark, stem, and root). Ethanol extract had antimicrobial activities against selected animal pathogens such as E. coli O157 H:7 , S. aureus, S. typhi, S. pyogenes, S. aureus, L. monocytogenes, and C. jejuni. Also, this study showed that E. coli O157 H:7 and S. aureus had resistance against penicillin.
